title: Research
text:
Labor & Education Economics; Development; Applied Microeconometrics. Current themes: teacher/classroom quality, peer effects, skill formation, social security policies.




Interactions: Do Teacher Behaviors Predict Achievement, Executive Function, and Non-Cognitive Outcomes in Elementary School? (with Carneiro, Campos, Cruz-Aguayo, Schady).
The Asymmetric Effects of High-Achiever Peers: Experimental Evidence from Ecuador (with Cruz-Aguayo, Fuertes).





Effect of Aligning Health Benefits Between Contributory and Non-Contributory Regimes on Labor Market Outcomes: Evidence from Colombia.





Echeverri Durán, C., Restrepo, D. M., & Morales, L. F. (2019). Sustainable transport and housing market: An analysis for Medellín. Desarrollo y Sociedad (83), 145–183.





Beuermann, D., De Hoop, J., Cruz-Aguayo, Y., Echeverri Durán, C., et al. (2024). Suriname Poverty and Equity Assessment.




LACEA-LAMES (2019); Congreso Anual Red de Investigadores de Economía (2019); IEA World Congress (2023).

title: Home
text:
Hello, I’m Carolina Echeverri
Ph.D. Student in Applied Economics, University of Minnesota
Research areas: Labor & Education Economics; Development; Applied Micro
I study how inputs to human capital formation influence medium- and long-term outcomes, focusing on teacher quality, peer effects, and the effects of non-contributory benefits on individuals’ labor supply and participation in formal employment.
Currently: Ph.D. student (Applied Economics), University of Minnesota.
Links: GitHub: https://github.com/cechev
